intro: Cynoglossum lithospermifolium, commonly known as the rock-plantain, is a perennial herb native to arid and semi-arid regions of Central Asia. It belongs to the Boraginaceae family and is characterized by its hairy stems and broad, heart-shaped leaves. The plant produces small, blue or purple flowers that bloom in summer, attracting pollinators such as bees and butterflies. Its leaves and flowers contain bioactive compounds, making it of interest in traditional and modern medicinal research. Cynoglossum lithospermifolium is often found growing in rocky soils and is adapted to withstand harsh environmental conditions.
